attributes.action: Segregated, none-broken, cycle lanes on all A roads by 2020
attributes.additional_details:
Making bikes the fastest way into any town while making it safe will improve every city and town in this country. Cars pollute, destroy the scenery, take up more parking space than bikes too. Also, active transport is the real way to help the country's declining health by integrate activity into daily life. There's space on most A-Roads without land acquisition to build proper segregated cycle tracks. This investment will save the country a lot of money, both on a personal and national level.

Make bike lanes, not bus lanes.

My full argument is below.

http://2wheeledcommuter.blogspot.co.uk/2013/01/a-roads-should-accommodate-properly-for.html
